main event: A civilian observed a peculiar object in the sky over Los Angeles for about 7-8 seconds on May 20, 1953.
interesting points: The object was reported as rising and was observed from a distance., The situation was concluded to be a meteorite, indicating a natural phenomenon., The observation duration was brief, lasting only 7-8 seconds., There was no photograph or physical evidence associated with the sighting., The report was evaluated by the U.S. Air Force with the conclusion leaning towards balloons in other cases.
witness description: a civilian observer with prior training in anti-aircraft observation
